name: tyrannosaurus rex
description: The Tyrannosaurus Rex was one of the largest land predators to ever roam the Earth. With powerful jaws capable of crushing bone, it dominated its ecosystem roughly 68 million years ago.

name: triceratops
description: The Triceratops was a large herbivorous dinosaur recognizable by its three distinct facial horns and large bony frill. Living around 68 million years ago, it used its horns for defense against predators like Tyrannosaurus.

name: apatosaurus
description: Apatosaurus was a large, long-necked herbivorous dinosaur that lived during the Late Jurassic period. Known for its massive size and long tail, it fed on plants high in the trees.

name: velociraptor
description: Velociraptor was a small but fast and agile carnivorous dinosaur. It hunted in packs and was known for its sharp claws and intelligence, living about 75 million years ago.

name: mosasaurus
description: Mosasaurus was a massive marine reptile that lived during the Late Cretaceous period. With a powerful tail and jaws lined with sharp teeth, it was one of the top predators of the ancient seas.

name: allosaurus
description: Allosaurus was a large carnivorous dinosaur that roamed during the Late Jurassic period. It was a top predator with sharp claws and teeth, hunting large herbivorous dinosaurs.

name: parasaurolophus
description: Parasaurolophus was a herbivorous dinosaur known for its long, backward-curving cranial crest. It likely used this crest to produce sounds for communication and to help with visual display.

name: anhanguera
description: Anhanguera was a flying reptile belonging to the pterosaur group. It had a long, narrow snout with conical teeth suited for catching fish, and it likely hunted over coastal waters. Its wingspan could reach up to 4.5 meters.

name: microraptor
description: Microraptor was a small, feathered dinosaur with wings on both its arms and legs, allowing it to glide between trees. It was one of the first dinosaurs known to have had the ability to fly or glide, and it likely preyed on insects, small mammals, and birds.

name: spinosaurus
description: Spinosaurus was one of the largest carnivorous dinosaurs, known for its distinctive sail-like structure on its back. It likely hunted fish and other aquatic prey, and may have been semi-aquatic, spending much of its time in rivers and swamps.

name: pteranodon
description: Pteranodon was a large pterosaur with a wingspan of up to 7 meters. It had a long, toothless beak and a backward-extending crest on its head. Pteranodon likely fed on fish, soaring over oceans and coastlines.

name: stegosaurus
description: Stegosaurus was a herbivorous dinosaur known for the large, bony plates along its back and the spiked tail used for defense. Despite its size, it had a relatively small brain and was a slow-moving, plant-eating dinosaur.

name: pachycephalosaurus
description: Pachycephalosaurus was a herbivorous dinosaur known for its thick, domed skull, which could be up to 25 cm thick. It likely used its head for display, species recognition, and possibly head-butting contests.

name: ankylosaurus
description: Ankylosaurus was a heavily armored herbivorous dinosaur from the Late Cretaceous. It had bony plates covering its body and a massive club-like tail, used to defend against predators.

name: maiasaura
description: Ankylosaurus was a heavily armored herbivorous dinosaur from the Late Cretaceous. It had bony plates covering its body and a massive club-like tail, used to defend against predators.
